com.marklogic.hub

Interface HubConfig

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HubConfigImpl

    public interface HubConfig
    An interface to set, manage and recall the Data Hub's Configuration. HubConfig has a singleton scope so set everything you want at the start of the application and and then call refreshProject() to wire up all clients and load the properties from gradle.properties (optionally overridden with gradle-{env}.properties).

      In a non-Gradle environment, a client can use this to load properties from a "gradle-(environment).properties" file, similar to how the Gradle properties plugin would process such a file in a Gradle context.

      • getAppConfig

        com.marklogic.appdeployer.AppConfig getAppConfig()
        Returns the current AppConfig object attached to the HubConfig
        Returns:
        Returns current AppConfig object set for HubConfig

      • setAppConfig

        void setAppConfig(com.marklogic.appdeployer.AppConfig config)
        Sets the AppConfig for the current HubConfig
        Parameters:
        config - AppConfig to associate with the HubConfig

      • setAppConfig

        void setAppConfig(com.marklogic.appdeployer.AppConfig config,
                  boolean skipUpdate)
        Sets the AppConfig for the current HubConfig, with skipUpdate option
        Parameters:
        config - - AppConfig to associate with the HubConfig
        skipUpdate - false to force update of AppConfig, true to skip it

      • newStagingClient

        com.marklogic.client.DatabaseClient newStagingClient()
        Gets a new DatabaseClient that queries the staging database and appserver
        Returns:
        A client that accesses the hub's staging appserver and staging database.

      • newReverseFlowClient

        com.marklogic.client.DatabaseClient newReverseFlowClient()
        Gets a new DatabaseClient that queries the Final database using the staging appserver.
        Returns:
        A database client configured for fetching from final database, but using DHF's staging modules.

      • newFinalClient

        com.marklogic.client.DatabaseClient newFinalClient()
        Gets a new DatabaseClient that queries the Final database using the final appserver. and final modules database. (Future, will be same behavior as newReverseFlowClient when modules databases are merged.)
        Returns:
        A DatabaseClient

      • getInfo

        java.lang.String getInfo()
        Gets information on a datahub configuration
        Returns:
        information on the datahub configuration as a string

      • createProject

        void createProject(java.lang.String projectDirString)
        Initializes the java application state to a specific location. A properties file is expected to be found in this directory.
        Parameters:
        projectDirString - The directory in which to find properties for a project.

      • withPropertiesFromEnvironment

        HubConfig withPropertiesFromEnvironment(java.lang.String environment)
        In a non-Gradle environment, a client can use this to load properties from a "gradle-(environment).properties" file, similar to how the Gradle properties plugin would process such a file in a Gradle context.
        Parameters:
        environment - - The name of the environment to use (local,dev,qa,prod,...)
        Returns:
        A HubConfig

      • refreshProject

        void refreshProject()
        Loads HubConfig object with values from gradle.properties (optionally overridden with gradle-(environment).properties). Once Spring creates HubConfig object and the project is initialized with createProject(String) you can use setter methods to change HubConfig properties and then call this method.
